trope_detail: Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 1513.1. Our position, orbiting planet M-113. On board the Enterprise, Mister Spock temporarily in command. On the planet the ruins of an ancient and long-dead civilization. Ships surgeon McCoy and myself are now beaming down to the planets surface. Our mission, routine medical examination of archaeologist Robert Crater and his wife Nancy. Routine but for the fact that Nancy Crater is that one woman in Doctor McCoys past.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): additional entry. Since our mission was routine, we had beamed down to the planet without suspicion. We were unaware each member of the landing party was seeing a different woman, a different Nancy Crater.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 1513.4. In orbit around planet M-113. One crewman, member of the landing party, dead by violence. Cause unknown, but we are certain the cause of death was not poison.
Ship's Log-4 (Kirk): Stardate 1513.8. I am now certain that the violent death of my crewmen was caused by some strange life-form.

Ship's Log-5 (Kirk): additional. Armed and able-bodied crewmen are not attacked and slaughtered this easily. Apparently, the killer can immobilize them as it approacHe's perhaps with some hypnotic or paralyzing power. The answer lies with Professor Crater.
Ship's Log-6 (Kirk): continuing. The Enterprise has been invaded by a creature capable of assuming any form, and with the capacity to paralyze and draw the life from any one of us.
Kirk: Lt, contact Starfleet command.
Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 1533.6. Now maneuvering to come alongside cargo vessel Antares. Its Captain and First officer are beaming over to us with an unusual passenger.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 1533.7. We have taken aboard an unusual passenger for transport to Colony Alpha Five. Charles Evans, the sole survivor of a transport crash fourteen years ago. The child, alone from age three, has not only survived, but has grown to intelligent, healthy adolescence.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 1535.8. UESPA headquarters notified of the mysterious loss of science probe vessel Antares.
Kirk: This must be a space first. A transport ship that doesn't need anything? | Ramart: Nothing. | Kirk: Not even Saurian brandy? | Ramart: We're fine, thank you. Pleasant journey, Captain.
Kirk is shirtless in gym during a workout.
Kirk attempts to explain to Charlie Evans about what's wrong with slapping Yeoman Rand on ass. He doesn't understand.
Kirk fumbles the talk with Charlie Evans about Yeoman Rand. Odd for the supposed womanizing Kirk.
Kirk loves his ship more than anything and wants Charlie to give it back.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Star date 1312.4. The impossible has happened. From directly ahead, were picking up a recorded distress signal, the call letters of a vessel which has been missing for over two centuries. Did another Earth ship once probe out of the galaxy as we intend to do? What happened to it out there? Is this some warning they've left behind?
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Star date 1312.9. Ships condition, heading back on impulse power only. Main engines burned out. The ships space warp ability gone. Earth bases which were only days away are now years in the distance. Our overriding question now is what destroyed the Valiant? They lived through the barrier, just as we have. What happened to them after that?
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 1313.3. Note commendations on Lieutenant Kelso and the engineering staff. In orbit above us, the engines of the Enterprise are almost fully regenerated. Balance of the landing party is being transported back up. Mitchell, whatever he's become, keeps changing, growing stronger by the minute.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Ship's Log-4 (Kirk): Stardate 1313.8. Add to official losses, Doctor Elizabeth Dehner. Be it noted she gave her life in performance of her duty. Lieutenant Commander Lt. Cmdr. Gary Mitchell, same notation. I want his service record to end that way. He didn't ask for what happened to him.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Kirk rips his shirt in a fight with Lt. Cmdr. Gary Mitchell on Delta Vega.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope: Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu
trope_detail: Kirk kills a nearly omnipotent being (Lt. Cmdr. Gary Mitchell) during their fight on Delta Vega.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Kirk ribs Spock about his heritage in the ending sequence.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Kirk: Must be terrible having bad blood like that. (Kirk kidding Spock about his human half.)
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Kirk and Lt. Cmdr. Gary Mitchell fight on surface of Delta Vega.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Kirk reminds the doctor (McCoy) that for all his vaunted powers, Lt. Cmdr. Gary Mitchell is still human, subject to human frailties.
ep_title: Where No Man Has Gone Before

trope_detail: Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Our position, orbiting Psi 2000, an ancient world, now a frozen wasteland, about to rip apart in its death throes. Our mission, pick up a scientific party below, observe the disintegration of the planet.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 1704.2. The science party we were to have picked up has been found dead. Life support systems had been turned off. Station personnel, frozen to death. Conditions highly unusual. Meanwhile, we remain in orbit to complete our mission, close scientific measurement of the break-up of this planet.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): supplemental. Our orbit tightening. Our need for efficiency, critical. But unknown to us, a totally new and unusual disease has been brought aboard.
Ship's Log-4 (Kirk): Stardate 1704.4. Ship out of control, spiraling down towards planet Psi 2000. We have nineteen minutes of life left without engine power or helm control.
Ship's Log-5 (Kirk): supplemental. The Enterprise, spiraling down out of control. Ships outer skin heating rapidly due to friction with planet atmosphere.
McCoy rips Kirks shirt to give Kirk a injection. Everybody else gets an injection through their clothes.
Kirk can't tell Yeoman Rand how he feels cause he's the Captain. Kirk: (gazing at Yeoman Rand) No beach to walk on. | Yeoman Rand: Sir?
Kirk: I have a beautiful yeoman. Have you noticed her, Mister Spock? You're allowed to notice her. The Captain's not permitted.
Kirk: I've got it, the disease. Love. You're better off without it, and I'm better off without mine. This vessel, I give, she takes. She won't permit me my life. I've got to live hers.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 1672.1. Specimen-gathering mission on planet Alpha 177. Unknown to any of us during this time, a duplicate of me, some strange alter ego, had been created by the transporter malfunction.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 1672.9. On the planets surface, temperatures are beginning to drop, our landing party there in growing jeopardy. Due to the malfunction of the ships transporter, an unexplained duplicate of myself definitely exists.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 1673.1. Something has happened to me. Somehow, in being duplicated, I have lost my strength of will. Decisions are becoming more and more difficult.

Ship's Log-4 (Kirk): Stardate 1673.5. Transporter still inoperable. My negative self is under restraint in Sickbay. My own indecisiveness growing. My force of will steadily weakening. On the planet, condition critical. Surface temperature is seventy five degrees below zero, still dropping.
Kirk fights Evil-Kirk in engineering.
Kirk changes from gold uniform to green uniform which shows more of his chest.
Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 1329.8. The U.S.S. Enterprise in pursuit of an unidentified vessel.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 1329.1. We've taken aboard from an unregistered transport vessel its captain and, and three unusual females. These women have a mysterious magnetic effect on the male members of my crew, including myself. Explanation unknown at present.

Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 1329.2. On board the U.S.S. Enterprise, a ships hearing is being convened against the transport vessels captain. I'm becoming concerned about the almost-hypnotic effect produced by the women.

Ship's Log-4 (Kirk): Stardate 1330.1. Position, fourteen hours out of Rigel 12. We're on auxiliary impulse engines. Fuel low, barely sufficient to achieve orbit over the planet. Lithium replacements are now imperative. The effect of Mudd's women on my crew continues to grow, still totally unexplained. Harry Mudd is confined to his quarters under guard.
Ship's Log-5 (Kirk): Transporting down to surface of planet Rigel 12 to acquire replacement lithium crystals. Expect further difficulty from miners.

Ship's Log-6 (Kirk): Have transported aboard the Enterprise to implement search with infrared scanners and sensing system. Magnetic storms on the planets surface are cutting down speed and efficiency of our equipment. Search now in progress for three hours, eighteen minutes.
Ship's Log-7 (Kirk): Have expended all but forty three minutes of power. Ships condition, critical. Search now in progress seven hours, thirty one minutes. Magnetic storms are easing.
Kirk tells Harry Mudd the miners had a subspace radio marriage.
Ruth Bonavure
Harry Mudd sends Ruth Bonavure to seduce Kirk for information. She can't go through with it. The drug was wearing off.
Kirk: A woman only needs to think she's beautiful to be beautiful.
Kirk is in love with his ship. Hell do anything to save her.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 2712.4. A signal from planet Exo 3. Doctor Roger Korby has been located, he and part of his expedition remaining alive due to the discovery of underground ruins left by the former inhabitants of this world.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Korby: This is necessary, Captain. You will understand. Andrea. | Andrea reaches for Kirk's phaser, but Kirk grabs her to use as a shield. Kirk aims at Brown instead, while moving towards a table to use as a barrier instead of the Andrea.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk: Put it on all frequencies.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk: I'm tired of your half-breed interference Kirk (thinks this while in duplication machine to put a defect into the android double).
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk-android insults Spock with half-breed comment Kirk instilled in it.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk chokes Dr. Korby with rope.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk fights Dr. Korby.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk fights Ruk. Kirk loses.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk fights Ruk. Kirk loses.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk fights Ruk. Kirk loses.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk commands Andrea to kiss him. She begins to have conflict between Kirk and Dr. Korby.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Andrea, the girl of the week, is an android. But Kirk will kiss anything that shapely.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk forces the robotized Dr. Korby to realize that he's mad and that drives him to suicide.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk makes Andrea reject her programming.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk makes Kirk-android act out of character by thinking racist thoughts about Spock.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk makes Ruk remember why the androids revolted against the Old Ones. Ruk leaves him and goes off to kill Dr. Korby.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk seduces the android Andrea. She can't resist him.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk in duplication machine, naked.
ep_title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?

trope_detail: Kirk interferes with world where biological experiment killed all adults. Having no parents isn't a normal course of development so Kirk figured it was okay to interfere.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 2713.5. In the distant reaches of our galaxy, we have made an astonishing discovery. Earth type radio signals coming from a planet which apparently is an exact duplicate of the Earth. It seems impossible, but there it is.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 2713.6. The building Miri led us to also housed an automatic transmission station, which sent out the signal that drew us to this planet. We also discovered something else. That the blues blotches, characteristic of the unknown disease had appeared on each of us, with the exception of Mister Spock. There was a well-equipped laboratory in the building. Doctor McCoy took tissue samples of each of us in an attempt to isolate the organism responsible.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Doctor McCoy's bio computer and a portable electronic microscope have been beamed down from the Enterprise. They will be used in conjunction with computer banks on-board ship.
Ship's Log-4 (Kirk): supplement. This is the second day of the seven left to us. We've found nothing. Enterprise is standing by with labs and computers ready to assist us.

Ship's Log-5 (Kirk): Stardate 2717.3. Three days, seven hours left to us. Investigation proves that the supply of food in the area is running dangerously low. Unless something is done, the children will starve in a few months. The disease is working on each of us according to Doctor McCoy's prediction. Our tempers are growing short, and we're no further along than we were two days ago.
Kirk rips his shirt in a fight with children.
Miri: Her name was Louise. She was just a little bit older than I am when it happened. Oh, Jim. | Miri gives Kirk a big hug.
Kirk punches diseased boy in street who attacked McCoy after he touched the bike. Kirk punches him several times in face.
Kirk fights diseased girl in deserted building.
Miri whom Kirk has grown to care about.

McCoy: The disease, Captain, the one they created three hundred years ago. | Rand: There's a chance! | McCoy: A chance. At least it's a race now, and we've just wasted a minute. (Kirk turns to Yeoman Rand and hugs her.)
After McCoy announces the good news he may have found the magic antidote, Kirk turns to hug Yeoman Rand.
Kirk flirts with a 300 year old child.
Kirk: What's your name? | Miri: Miri. | Kirk: Miri. A pretty name for a pretty young woman. | Miri: Pretty? | Kirk: Very pretty.
Kirk and Dr. Helen Noel get jostled in the turbolift and fall into an uncomfortable hug.
Kirk, after Dr. Helen Noel implants the suggestion in his mind with the Neural Neutralize, plants a big, wet kiss on Dr. Helen Noel.
Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 2715.1. Exchanged cargo with penal colony on Tantalus V. I've departed without going ashore.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 2715.2. Standard orbit, planet Tantalus V.

Kirk: What's so fascinating? | Spock: An identification tape from our ship's library on Doctor Simon Van Gelder. | Kirk: Doctor Van Gelder? | Spock: Doctor Van Gelder, Captain. No mistake. There's a full ID tape on him. | Kirk: Committed to Tantalus colony when? | Spock: Assigned there six months ago as Doctor Adams' associate.
Kirk: Ship to surface, Tantalus colony.
Kirk and Dr. Van Gelder fight on bridge.
Dr. Helen Noel, a psychiatrist whom Kirk had a one-night stand with at a Christmas party.
Kirk had a one-night fling with Dr. Helen Noel at a Christmas party.
Kirk bluffs about the Corbomite Device.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 1512.2. On our third day of star mapping, an unexplained cubical object blocked our vessel's path. On the Bridge, Mister Spock immediately ordered general alert. My location, Sickbay. Quarterly physical check.
Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 1513.8. Star maps reveal no indication of habitable planets nearby. Origin and purpose of the cube still unknown. We've been here, held motionless, for eighteen hours.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 1514.0. The cube has been destroyed. Ships damage minor but my next decision, major. Probe on ahead or turn back.

Ship's Log-4 (Kirk): Stardate 1514.1. The Enterprise is in tow. To this point, no resistance has been offered. My plan? A show of resignation. Balok's tractor beam has to be a heavy drain of power on his small ship. Question. Will he grow careless?
Kirk: Ship to ship. | Uhura: Hailing frequencies open.
Kirk: Ship to ship. | Uhura: Hailing frequencies open.
Kirk: Ship to ship. | Uhura: Hailing frequencies open.
Kirk: Ship to ship. | Uhura: Hailing frequencies open.
Kirk: Ship to ship. | Uhura: Hailing frequencies open.

Kirk: Since the early years of space exploration, Earth vessels have had incorporated into them a substance known as corbomite. It is a material and a device which prevents attack on us. If any destructive energy touches our vessel, a reverse reaction of equal strength is created, destroying the attacker! It may interest you to know that since the initial use of corbomite more than two of our centuries ago, no attacking vessel has survived the attempt. Death has little meaning to us. If it has none to you then attack us now. We grow annoyed at your foolishness.
Kirk: Have you tried all hailing frequencies? | Spock: Affirmative. No answer from the cube
Kirk: When I find the headquarters genius that assigned me a Yeoman. | McCoy What's the matter Jim, don't you trust yourself?.
Kirk shirtless while McCoy gives him an exam.
Kirk is in love with his ship.
Kirk and Commodore Mendez in a Shuttlecraft following the hijacked Enterprise.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 3012.4. Despite our best efforts to disengage computers, the Enterprise is still locked on a heading for the mysterious planet Talos Four. Meanwhile, as required by Starfleet General Orders, a preliminary hearing on Lieutenant Commander Spock is being convened. And in all the years of my service, this is the most painful moment I've ever faced.
Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 3012.6. General Court-Martial convened. Mister Spock has again waived counsel and has entered a plea of guilty.

Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): supplemental. Mister Spock, on trial for mutiny, has forced the court to accept unusual evidence. On our monitor screen, the voyage of Captain Pike and the Enterprise to the one forbidden world in all the galaxy.
Kirk: Hailing Enterprise. (calling from shuttlecraft).
Ship's Log-1 (Kirk-personal): Stardate 3013.1. I find it hard to believe the events of the past twenty four hours or the plea of Mister Spock standing general court-martial.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk-personal): Stardate 3013.2. Reconvening court-martial of Mister Spock and the strangest trial evidence ever heard aboard a starship. From the mysterious planet now only one hour ahead of us, the story of Captain Pikes imprisonment there.
Kirk and Lenore ready to kiss but are interrupted by the find of a dead body.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 2817.6. Starship Enterprise diverted from scheduled course. Purpose, to confirm discover by Doctor Thomas Leighton of an extraordinary new synthetic food which would totally end the threat of famine on Cygnia Minor, a nearby Earth colony.
Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 2818.9. There are many questions in my mind, too many, perhaps, about the actor Karidian and his daughter. For personal reasons, I'm almost afraid to learn the answers.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 2819.1. Ships officer Riley's condition worsening. Doctor McCoy making lab analysis to determine cause and antidote. Entire crew deeply concerned.
Ship's Log-5 (Kirk): Stardate 2819.8. Suspect under surveillance. Strategic areas under double guard. Performance of the Karidian Players taking place as scheduled.
Kirk: All channels cleared Uhura? | Uhura: All channels cleared.
Thomas Leighton's widow, Martha, briefly clings to Kirk as she weeps.
Lenore, Kodos daughter. Kirk flirts with Lenore to get information about her father.
Kirk and Lenore have a romantic stroll on the shuttle craft observation deck.
Kirk almost killed by Lenore with overloaded phaser placed in his quarters.
Kirk's flirting with Lenore is fake.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 1709.2. Patrolling outposts guarding the neutral zone between planets Romulus and Remus and the rest of the galaxy, received emergency call from outpost 4. The U.S.S. Enterprise is moving to investigate and assist.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 1709.6. We are at the Neutral Zone. Have lost contact with the intruder. No reaction on our motion sensors but believe the Romulan vessel to be somewhere close by; With all engines and systems shut down, the Enterprise is also playing the silent waiting game in hope of regaining contact.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): supplemental. Now motionless for nine hours, forty seven minutes.
Kirk: Contact remaining outposts.
Kirk: Make a challenge. Warn that ship off. | Uhura: Trying to, sir. They don't acknowledge.
Kirk: Warn that ship off | Uhura: They don't acknowledge.
Kirk (directed at Lt. Stiles after hinted Spock was a Romulan spy): Leave any bigotry in your quarters, there's no room for it on the bridge.
Kirk violates inviolable Starfleet orders not to enter the Romulan Neutral Zone. He feels he must destroy that invading ship to avert a war.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 3025 er, point 3. We are orbiting an uninhabited planet in the Omicron Delta region. A planet remarkably like Earth, or how we remember Earth to be. Park-like, beautiful, green, flowers, trees, green lawn, quiet and restful. Almost too good to be true.
Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 3025.8. Investigation of this increasingly unusual planet continues, and we are seeing things that cannot possibly exist, yet they are undeniably real.

Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): supplemental. All contact with the Enterprise has been lost. We're trapped here. Our ships surgeon, my personal friend, is dead. We're certain now that whatever were facing is terribly real.
Kirk rips shirt in fight with Finnegan.
Ruth, an old flame, is a facsimile on the shore leave planet.
Kirk shoots charging knight with handgun found by Sulu earlier.
Kirk and Ruth kiss and remember the good times when they were a couple.
Kirk's rock
Kirk goes off with the facsimile of Ruth, his old flame.
Kirk stares at the two nearly naked showgirls that McCoy's has on his arms.
Ruth is a very special lady from Kirk's past. She's never spoke of again.
Finnegan was an academy classmate of Kirk's who razed Kirk and picked a lot of fights.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 2821.5. On route to Makus Three with a cargo of medical supplies. Our course leads us past Murasaki 312, a quasar-like formation, vague, undefined. A priceless opportunity for scientific investigation. On board is Galactic High Commissioner Ferris, overseeing the deliver of the medicines to Makus Three.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 2821.7. The electromagnetic phenomenon known as Murasaki Three Twelve whirls like some angry blight in space, a depressive reminder that seven shipmates still have not been heard from. Equally bad, the effect has rendered our normal searching systems useless. Without them, we are blind and almost helpless.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 2822.3. We continue to search, but I find it more difficult each moment to ward off a sense of utter futility and great loss.

Ship's Log-4 (Kirk): Stardate 2823.1. Our landing parties are on the surface of Taurus Two. We continue to hope. Instruments are slowly returning to an operable condition as the ion storm slowly disperses. On the ship, we can only wait helplessly.
Ship's Log-5 (Kirk): supplement. The search parties have returned to the ship, and the Columbus is on its way back. I have been compelled to abandon the search.
Kirk: Anything? | Uhura: All wavelengths dominated by ionization effects. | Kirk: Order columbus on new search path.
Kirk: Open a channel: | Uhura : Frequency open sir | Kirk: Anything? | Uhura: All wavelengths dominated by ionization effects. | Kirk: Order Columbus on new search path.
Kirk: Order Columbus on new search path.
Kirk: Recall search parties and recall the Columbus.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 2126.1. Delayed report. The whole bridge crew are the unwilling guests of the creature who calls himself Trelane. We are weaponless, powerless, and our only hope of escape with the Enterprise lies in playing his games. I've decided to make my move with the field of honour game, and everything depends on my one chance with the ancient duelling pistol.
Kirk: Does your logic find this fascinating?  | Spock: Fascinating I use for the unexpected. In this case, interesting should suffice.
Kirk: Notify the discovery on subspace radio.
Kirk and Trelane square off with dueling pistols after Kirk challenges Trelane.
Trelane fights Kirk during his hunt.
Kirk shoots mirror behind Trelane with dueling pistol destroying his machine.
Kirk dishes out a You Suck speech to Trelane, along with a couple of bitch slaps.
Kirk shoots Gorn with makeshift cannon he created from material throw on the rocks.
Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 3045.6 The Enterprise has responded to a call from Earth observation outpost on Cestus Three. On landing, we have discovered that the outpost has been destroyed.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): supplement. We have beamed back to the Enterprise and immediately set out in pursuit of the alien vessel. It appears to be headed toward a largely unexplored section of the galaxy.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 3046.2. We are in hot pursuit of the alien vessel which destroyed the Earth outpost on Cestus Three.
Kirk and Gorn fight. Kirk is totally outmatched in strength and stamina.
Kirk's rock.

trope: Trying To Catch Me Fighting Dirty
trope_detail: Kirk pushes a big rock on Gorn but it has little effect.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 3113.2. We were en-route to Starbase 9 for resupply when a black star of high gravitational attraction began to drag us toward it. It required all warp power in reverse to pull us away from the star. But, like snapping a rubber band, the breakaway sent us plunging through space, out of control, to stop here, wherever we are.
Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): supplemental. Engineering Officer Scott informs warp engines damaged, but can be made operational and reenergised.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 3113.7. Our engines are being repaired, but we are still locked in time, and we have aboard a passenger whom we do not want, and we cannot return.
Ship's Log-5 (Kirk): Stardate 3114.1. We must make an attempt to break free of this time, or we and our reluctant passengers will remain its prisoners. All we have is a theory and a few facts.
Kirk attacks three USAF guards to give Sulu chance to escape with the evidence.
Kirk fights USAF base Security Captain.
Kirk knocks out Captain Christopher.
Enterprise computer keeps calling Kirk dear after being repaired on Sigma 14.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 2947.3. We have been through a severe ion storm. One crewman is dead. Ships damage is considerable. I have ordered a non-scheduled layover on Starbase Eleven for repairs. A full report of damages was made to the commanding officer of Starbase Eleven, Commodore Stone.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): Stardate 2948.5. Starship Enterprise remains in orbit around Starbase Eleven. Full repairs in progress. I've been ordered to stand by on Starbase Eleven until the inquiry into the death of Lieutenant Commander Finney can be conducted. I'm confident of the outcome.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 2948.9. The officers who will comprise my court-martial board are proceeding to Starbase Eleven. Meanwhile, repairs on the Enterprise are almost complete.
Ship's Log-5 (Kirk): Stardate 2950.1. After due consideration, the general court-martial has reconvened on board the Enterprise.
Kirk rips shirt in fight with Lt. Finney.
Kirk takes hold of Jamie Finneys shoulders to comfort her.
Kirk fights Lt. Finney in engineering.
Areel Shaw, Kirks old flame, is the prosecuting attoney.
Kirk has a Saurian brandy.
Kirk and Areel Shaw kiss . Then she tells him she's the prosecuter.
Areel Shaw is a special woman from Kirks past never to be heard of again.
Kirk flirts with Areel Shaw in bar hoping for a quickie.
Kirk is in love with his ship.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 3156.2. While orbiting planet Beta Three trying to find some trace of the starship Archon that disappeared here a hundred years ago, a search party consisting of two Enterprise officers were sent to the planet below. Mister Sulu has returned, but in a highly agitated mental state. His condition requires I beam down with an additional search detail.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): stardate 3157.4. The Enterprise, still under attack by some sort of heat rays from the surface of Beta Three, is now being commanded by Engineering Officer Scott. The shore party has been taken by the creature called Landru.

Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): stardate 3158.7 The Enterprise is preparing to leave Beta Three in Star system C One Eleven. Sociologist Lindstrom is remaining behind with a party of experts who will help restore the planets culture to a human form.
Kirk knocks out minion.
Kirk subdues McCoy who is conditioned by Landru as McCoy attempts to cry out for help.
Kirk convinced Landru-computer that it was killing the body by halting their progress through Mind Control.
Kirk interferes with computer controlled society which is technically dead.
Kirk interferes with the planet by destroying the Landru computer.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3141.9. A full hour has elapsed since interception of the strange vessel. Our presence alongside is still being completely ignored. Although our sensors continue to show signs of equipment and life aboard, there has been no indication of danger to us.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): supplemental. Alongside the SS Botany Bay for ten hours now. A boarding party of engineering and medical specialists are now completing their examination of the mysterious vessel. Attempts to revive other sleepers await our success or failure with the casualty already beamed over. Doctor McCoy is frankly amazed at his physical and recuperative power.

Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 3143.3. Control of the Enterprise has been regained. I wish my next decisions were no more difficult. Khan and his people. What a waste to put them in a reorientation centre. And what do I do about McGivers?
Kirk and Khan fight in engineering.
Kirk: Men were more adventuresome and bolder, more colorful | Lt. McGivers: Yes sir, I think they were.

trope: Trying To Catch Me Fighting Dirty
trope_detail: Kirk pulls out a metal rod from the control panel and beats on Khan till he's unconscience
Kirk determines peaceful contact is not possible. So Kirk takes drastic action y destroying the disintigration chambers.
Kirk's violent actions is aimed at stopped Eminiars senseless computer war.
While being held captive, Kirk gets an order to Scotty, General Order 24 - total destruction of planet in two hours.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3192.1. The Enterprise is en route to star cluster NGC 321. Objective, to open diplomatic relations with the civilisations known to be there. We have sent a message to Eminiar Seven, principal planet of the star cluster, informing them of our friendly intentions. We are awaiting an answer.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): stardate 3192.5. Now in standard orbit around planet Eminiar Seven. My orders are clear. We must establish diplomatic relations at all cost. Preparing to beam down to planet surface.

Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): delayed. The Enterprise, in orbit about Eminiar Seven, has been declared a casualty of an incredible war fought by computers. I and my landing party, though apparently not included as casualties aboard the Enterprise, are confined on the planets surface, awaiting what?
Kirk: Nothing yet Lt. Uhura? | Uhura: Nothing Captain, hailing frequencies are open.
Kirk fights four guards then grabs disrupter and holds them at bay.
Kirk fights three Eminiar guards but gets knocked out.
Kirk knocks out Eminiar guard.
Mea 3, a woman Kirk gives only a passing glance.
Kirk talks about how wasteful and absurd the Eminiar computer war was.
Kirk destroys computers to stop computer war.
Kirk interferes by destroying computer to set eminars free of their clean war.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3417.3. We thought our mission to Omicron Ceti Three would be an unhappy one. We had expected to find no survivors of the agricultural colony there. Apparently, our information was incorrect.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): supplemental. We have been ordered by Starfleet Command to evacuate the colony on Omicron Three. Howe'ver, the colony leader, Elias Sandoval, has refused all co-operation and will not listen to any arguments.

Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): Stardate 3417.5. The pod plants have spread spores throughout the ship, carried by the ventilation system. Under their influence, my crew is deserting to join the Omicron colony, and I can't stop them. I dont know why I have not been infected, nor can I get Doctor McCoy to explain the physical-psychological aspects of the infection.

Ship's Log-4 (Kirk): stardate 3417.7. Except for myself, all crew personnel have transported to the surface of the planet. Mutinied. Lieutenant Uhura has effectively sabotaged the communications station. I can only contact the surface of the planet. The ship can be maintained in orbit for several months, but even with automatic controls, I cannot pilot her alone. In effect, I am marooned here. I'm beginning to realise just how big this ship really is, how quiet. I dont know how to get my crew back, how to counteract the effect of the spores. I dont know what I can offer against paradise.

Ship's Log-5 (Kirk): upplemental. I think I've discovered the answer, but to carry out my plan entails considerable risk. Mister Spock is much stronger than the ordinary human being. Aroused, his great physical strength could kill. But its a risk Ill have to take.
Kirk: Put me thru to Starfleet | Uhura: I can't do that.
Kirk gets his ass handed to him by Spock, only surviving because Spock shook off the effects of the spores just in time.
Kirk insults Spock by telling him his father was a computer and his mother an encyclopedia.
Kirk purposely insults Spock to try to break the spores hold.
Kirk explains to Spock why they both can't go to the brig. There would be no one to run the ship and save the crew.
Kirk provokes reaction from Spock to get to fight hoping emotions will shake off spores hold.
Edith Keeler
Kirk: Man stagnates if he has no ambition, no desire to be more than he is.
Kirk has to deal a vicious speech to Spock in order to piss him off enough to get over the spores influence. An unusual case in that he didn't actually mean it.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3196.1. A distress call from the pergium production station on Janus Six has brought the Enterprise to that long-established colony. Mister Spock, Doctor McCoy, and I have beamed down to meet with Chief Engineer Vanderberg, administrative head of Janus Six.
Kirk (to Spock): I suspect you're becoming more and more human all the time.
Kirk wants to protect this society even if it hasnt progressed in over a milennia.
Kirk warns pre-warp society of the evils of the Klingons in attempt to save them. I thought that was a no-no.
Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3198.4. We have reached Organia and established standard orbit. No signs of hostile activities in this area.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): stardate 3201.7. Mister Spock and I are trapped on the planet Organia, which is in the process of being occupied by the forces of the Klingon Empire. The Organians have provided us with native clothing in the hopes we may be taken for Organians.
Kirk: I'm a soldier, not a diplomat.
Kirk garrotes Klingon while performing sabotage.
Kirk knocks out Klingon during act of sabotage.
Kirk: WE HAVE THE RIGHT  Ayelborne: To wage war? Is that what you're defending?.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3087.6. While investigating an uncharted planet, the Enterprise and at least this entire quadrant of space, has been subjected to violent, unexplained stress and force. Sensors have reported the presence of a human being on the planet below who might be connected with the phenomenon. With my first officer and a security team, I have set out in search of him.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): stardate 3088.3. We continue to orbit the dead planet, which seems to be the source of the phenomenon which has struck the Enterprise and all sections of the galaxy once again. As for Lazarus, the story he tells me about the humanoid continues to trouble me.

Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): stardate 3088.7. We are no closer to finding an answer to the strange phenomenon than we were at the beginning. Not only have two of my crewmen been attacked, two of our dilithium crystals are missing, and without them the Enterprise cannot operate at full power. They must be found.
Kirk: Send any communications priority one.
Kirk throws Lazarus into inter-dimensional corridor to meet up with anti-matter Lazarus.
Kirk's rock.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): supplemental entry. Two drops of cordrazine can save a mans life. A hundred times that amount has just accidentally been pumped into Doctor McCoys body. In a strange, wild frenzy, he has fled the ships Bridge. All connecting decks have been placed on alert. We have no way of knowing if the madness is permanent or temporary, or in what direction it will drive McCoy.
ep_title: The City on the Edge of Forever

trope_detail: Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): no stardate. For us, time does not exist. McCoy, back somewhere in the past, has effected a change in the course of time. All Earth history has been changed. There is no starship Enterprise. We have only one chance. We have asked the Guardian to show us Earths history again. Spock and I will go back into time ourselves and attempt to set right what ever it was that McCoy changed.
ep_title: The City on the Edge of Forever

trope_detail: Kirk: Broadcast to Starfleet command my last weeks log entries.

trope_detail: Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3287.2. The mass insanity we have tracked across this section of the galaxy seems to have already touched Deneva. That planet, colonised over a century ago, is one of the most beautiful in the galaxy.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): supplemental. Whatever the creatures are, they have apparently taken over all the inhabitants of Deneva. Meanwhile, ships surgeon Doctor McCoy is examining a strange puncture wound left by one of the creatures on Mister Spocks back.

Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): stardate 3289.8. I am faced with the most difficult decision of my life. Unless we find a way to destroy the creatures without killing their human hosts, my command responsibilities will force me to kill over a million people.
Kirk gives Uhura the private number of his brother Sam. | Kirk: Anything? | Uhura: I've tried every major transmitting station on Denova.none of them have acknowledged my contact signel.
Kirk: Anything? | Uhura: I've tried every major transmitting station on Denova.none of them have acknowledged my contact signel.
Kirk: Lt. Uhura, try to contact that ship.
Kirk holds Aurelan Kirk as she screams from the parasites sting.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3372.7. On course, on schedule, bound for Altair Six via Vulcan. First Officer Spock seems to be under stress. He has requested and been granted shore leave. Ship surgeon McCoy has him under medical surveillance.
Kirk rips shirt in Koon-Ut-Kal-If-Fee fight.
Kirk: Get me Starfleet command and pipe in down to Dr. McCoys office.
Kirks death faked by McCoy during fight with Spock on Vulcan.
Kirk takes Spock back to Vulcan even though he was ordered not to and proceed to the ceremony.
Kirk: Our forward tracter beams, adjust to repel.
Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3468.1. While approaching Pollux Four, a planet in the Beta Geminorum system, the Enterprise has been stopped in space by an unknown force of some kind.
Kirk speaks about not wanting it to have ended like that. Maybe they could have gathered a few laurel leaves.
Apollo uses strangles Kirk after zapping Scotty. He could kill them with his mind.
Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3541.9. The presence of Nomad aboard my ship has become nightmarish. Now it apparently means to return to Earth. Once there, it would automatically destroy all life.
Kirk: All hailing frequencies open | Uhura: Aye aye sir.
Kirk: Any response from the mylerian system? | Uhura: Not since their original distress call sir. I'm scanning all frequencies.
Kirk: Get Dr. McCoy down to the transport room | Uhura: Dr. McCoy to the transport room.
Kirk: Lt., try to make contact | Uhura: Aye aye sir.
Kirk gives Spock a cooldown hug after the Spock did a mind meld with a Nomad.
Kirk points out all of Nomads errors and tells it it must execute its prime function and sterilize.
Kirk and mirror Lt. Marlena Moreau kiss, long and passionate. Marlena: Its been a long time since youve kissed me like that.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate unknown. During an ion storm, my landing party has beamed back to the Enterprise and found it and the personnel aboard changed. The ship is subtly altered physically. Behaviour and discipline has become brutal, savage.
Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): supplemental. I command an Enterprise where officers apparently employ private henchmen among the crew, where assassination of superiors is a common means of advancing in rank.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): stardate unknown. We are trapped in a savage, parallel universe from which we must escape within four hours, or I will face a death sentence at Mister Spocks hands.
Kirk: What is it that will buy you? | Spock: Fascinating. (when Mirror Kirk tries to bribe Spock to release them.)
Kirk: Lt. Uhura, contact the Halken council. I wish to talk to them again.
Kirk: Lt. Uhura, Have Dr. McCoy and Mr. Scott meet me in my quarters.
Kirk holds Uhuras arms while telling her she's the only one who can can it. (get comms from Starfleet).
Kirk saved by double crossing henchman against Mirror Chekov.
Kirk fights Mirror Sulu after his three henchmen suddenly disappear.

trope_detail: Kirk, McCoy, Scotty, and Uhura fight Mirror Spock in sick bay.
Kirk lays his hand on Mirror Lt. Moreaus hands to comfort her.
Kirk thinks he and Lt. Moreau could become friends. Its possible. Then he walks over to talk to her.
Kirk (to Mirror Lt. Moreau): You're the Captains woman until he tells you you're not.
Kirk decides existing under Vaal is not living, its merely existing.
Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): stardate 3715.3. While making a routine exploration of the unexplored Gamma Trianguli Six, one of my men has been killed by a poisonous plant.

Ship's Log-2 (Kirk): supplementary, Our investigation of Gamma Trianguli Six has suddenly turned into a nightmare. We're being watched and followed, Mister Spock has been injured, and now we find we are unable to return to the ship.
Ship's Log-3 (Kirk): stardate 3715.6. We have been introduced to Vaal. Evidently the source of the planets power emanations and possibly the force that threatens both us and our ship.
Kirk punches Akuta, the native who doesn't fight back. Kirk apologizes for hitting him.
Kirk: Lt. Have Dr. McCoy, Mr. Scott, and a damage control party report to me in the transporter room.
Kirk: Lt. Palmer. | Lt. Palmer: I can't raise the Constellation sir. I'm still getting the distress beacon but there's heavy subspace interference.

Kirk: Ironic, isn't it. Way back in the 20th century , the H-bomb was the ultimate weapon., their doomsday machine. And we used something like it to destroy another doomsday machine. Probablt the firs time a weapon has been used for constructive purposes.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 3018.2. Crewman Jackson is dead and there are no apparent physical causes. Mister Scott and Mister Sulu are still out of touch on the planet below. Leaving Assistant Chief Engineer DeSalle in command of the Enterprise, I'm beaming down to the planets surface to find my two missing crewmen and discover what killed Jackson.
Kirk: Notify transporter room to beam up one member of the landing party. And have Dr. McCoy report to me in the transporter on the double. | Uhura: Yes sir.
Kirk knocks out McCoy with punch to the face.
Sylvia, The female magician. First time she's ever had a human form.
Kirk holds Sylvias arms from behind while caressing her.
Sylvia knew what she had and offered it to Kirkâ¦ who refused her.
Kirk kisses Sylvia passionately and she kisses him back.
Kirk kisses Sylvia. | Kirk: You're a very beautiful woman.
Kirk: You dont call that damage? | Sylvia: Why should I? | Kirk: you'd know, if you had compassion. A woman, should have compassion. But I forget you're not a woman.
Sylvia: Look at me. I'm a woman. I'm all women. | Kirk: I dont know what you are, but you're not a woman. and he throws her down to the floor.
Sylvia: Tell me about power. | Kirk runs his hand up her arm and carresses Sylvias face with sultry trumpet playing in the background.
Kirk extremely worried as the Enterprise is heating up in space.

Ship's Log-1 (Kirk): Stardate 4513.3. After having been taken over by an android, the Enterprise has been under way at warp seven for four days. Now we are entering orbit around a planet which has never been charted.
Kirk: Lt Uhura, have Mr. Spock report to the bridge. | Uhura, Aye aye sir.
Kirk hugs Uhura after her performance with Alice 1
Kirk confuses Alice 471 saying He's unhappy and wants the Enterprise. Alice 471 can't relate to the idea of unhappiness. It must be studied further.
Kirk: Harry. I want control of my ship returned immediately. We have no intension of staying as your guests
Kirk stranding Harry Mudd with 500 Stella androids was funny back then but would be considered cruel and unusual punishment today. Especially as they laughed at hm when they left.
The Corbomite device worked so well once, Kirk does it again in The Deadly Years.
If Kirk could best Shana then maybe the Gamesters would pick them as a pair.
Kirk, Chekov, and Uhura face two male and two female gladiators. Kirk and Chekov take one male each, while Uhura has to fight both women.

trope: What Is This Thing You Call Love
trope_detail: Kirks assigned gladiatorial trainer has lived her whole life as a slave and is ignorant of normal culture. She asks him, What is love? Kirk proceeds to show her.
Kirk makes up the game fizzbin to distract their guards.

trope: What Is This Thing You Call Love
trope_detail: Kirk attempts to seduce Kelinda, the female one, and while she initially realizes that's what He's attempting to do, she eventually starts to enjoy the new feeling, actually finding herself drawn to him. .
Kirk forced to kiss Uhura by telekenetic aliens.
Kirk fell in love with android rayna and was heartbroken when she died.
Kirk falls madly in love with the girl of the week.
